comments: Pre-existing shape complementarity at the Fab-cytochtome interface is enhanced by 48 bound water molecules and by local movements for antibody and cytochrome, comparing with the structures of free cytochrome c [PDB: 1HCR] and E8 antibody [PDB: 1QBL, 1QBM]. Ten water molecules are conserved between free and bound E8 and 15 water molecules are conserved between free and bound cytochrome. Antigen residues interacting with antibody through water-mediated contacts are not considered as epitope residues.

comments: Comparison of angiogenin (123 aa) in complex with Fab (this structure) with the structure of free angiogenin [PDB: 1B1I] revealed that antibody binding induces dramatic conformational changes in the cell binding region of angiogenin at the opposite end of the molecule from the antibody binding site. The epitope is located at two loops comprising residues 34-41 and 85-91. Their conformation does not change upon antibody binding. Residues 59-68 comprise the cell binding region. They change their conformation dramatically, Rmsd for ten Calpha atoms is 13.2 Angstrom. In free angiogenin, residues 62-68 are part of a beta-hairpin formed by beta-strands 2 and 3 and the intervening loop 66-68; residues 59-61 lie on a loop that connects the hairpin structure with alpha-helix 3. In the complex, the beta-strand 2 is lost, and the entire 58-67 segment forms a loop that extends much further out from the rest of the molecule than does beta-hairpin. The authors show that antibody binding, not crystal packing, induces the conformational change. The native conformation is critical for the interaction of angiogenin with surface components on its endothelial cell targets. Antibody binding disables angiogenin by destroying the native conformation of the cell binding region.

comments: Paratope residues and antigen-antibody contacts are not provided in the paper. There is only mention that the interactions between OspA and LA-2 include 8 direct H-bonds, 4 solvent-bridged hydrogen bonds, and 3 ion pairs. The crystal structure contains two identical complexes in the asymmetric unit. The mAb 336 epitope does not overlap with LA-2 epitope. Both are located in the C-terminal region of OspA. The MAb 184.1 epitope is located in the N-terminal of OspA [PDB: 1OSP].
